TopicTitle: RealChute: Auto-arm on staging doesn't work

Articles.Content:
Hi all

I habe been doing a small realism upgrade (no, not the complete realism overhaul) of my kerbosmos and as a part of it installed RealChute. I _do_ like it very much, save for one issue: I can't get the chutes to arm on staging. However I set the autoArm flag (via the settings GUI or by directly editing RealChute_Settings.cfg), I always have to hit the spacebar twice (stage, then arm) or to deploy manually by right-clicking the chute. No big deal if the chutes are in the last stage, but quite cumbersome if I want to stage other events after chute deployment, e.g separating the science package from the capsule.

Am I missing something or is this the intended behaviour?

Thanks for Help!

Madalone

Environment:

Mac OSX 10.9.5

KSP 0.25.0

RealChute 1.2.5.2

I made a simple test vehicle (Mk1 Pod, Mk16 Chute in stage 0, FL-T200 tank, LV-T45 engine in stage 1) and let it fly.

Hit space (11:09:17) -> takeoff; hit space (11:11:22) -> nothing; hit space (11:11:28) -> chute arms and deploys. Log extract:

Chris is about to release an update. I would wait until then, see if it fixes the problem, and if not post a support request on the real chute thread following this guide (as that is the only format Chris will accept, due to too many info-less requests).
